title: No block headers to write in this log period block will cause node to drift away with increase block leeway
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `2.38.0`

OS & Version: Linux

Chain/Network: BSC, Binance Smart Chain

#### Expected behaviour
Node should be synced with block head

#### Actual behaviour
`No block headers to write in this log period block number=xxx` cause node to spend more time on stage 2 and node drift away with increased block leeway

#### Backtrace

````
[INFO] [02-08|14:48:38.279] [2/15 Headers] No block headers to write in this log period block number=25490201
[INFO] [02-08|14:48:58.279] [2/15 Headers] No block headers to write in this log period block number=25490201
[INFO] [02-08|14:49:18.278] [2/15 Headers] No block headers to write in this log period block number=25490201
[INFO] [02-08|14:49:25.055] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth66=52 eth68=8
[INFO] [02-08|14:49:27.099] [txpool] stat                            block=25490140 pending=10000 baseFee=4 queued=30000 alloc=2.8GB sys=7.8GB
[INFO] [02-08|14:49:38.279] [2/15 Headers] No block headers to write in this log period block number=25490201
[INFO] [02-08|14:49:58.279] [2/15 Headers] No block headers to write in this log period block number=25490201
[INFO] [02-08|14:50:18.279] [2/15 Headers] No block headers to write in this log period block number=25490201
[INFO] [02-08|14:50:27.086] [txpool] stat                            block=25490140 pending=10000 baseFee=4 queued=30000 alloc=3.2GB sys=7.8GB
[INFO] [02-08|14:50:38.278] [2/15 Headers] No block headers to write in this log period block number=25490201
[INFO] [02-08|14:50:58.278] [2/15 Headers] No block headers to write in this log period block number=25490201
[INFO] [02-08|14:51:18.279] [2/15 Headers] No block headers to write in this log period block number=25490201
[INFO] [02-08|14:51:25.056] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth66=52 eth68=8
[INFO] [02-08|14:51:27.102] [txpool] stat                            block=25490140 pending=9999 baseFee=4 queued=30000 alloc=2.7GB sys=7.8GB
[INFO] [02-08|14:51:38.279] [2/15 Headers] No block headers to write in this log period block number=25490201
[INFO] [02-08|14:51:58.278] [2/15 Headers] No block headers to write in this log period block number=25490201
[INFO] [02-08|14:52:18.279] [2/15 Headers] No block headers to write in this log period block number=25490201
````

when reaching any block with `no headers`, erigon client intent to `trying` at stage 2 for a while before moving into the next block. happening on both `mainnet` and `testnet`
`[2/15 Headers] No block headers to write in this log period block number=25492320`

I got the same issue when upgrade version which is higher than 2.32. I tested with 2.36 2.37 and 2.38 but does not get the lucky. No block headers run in the loop, so I've reverted to 2.32 version to solve this issue.
as @naviocean pointed out: tried `v2.32.0`, seems able to handle `No block headers...` and node stay synced with block head
same here running erigon version 2.32.0-dev-7bf93727 for a while now. everything above v32.0 reintroduces the no block headers thingy

as mentioned by @justforfunya `. adding - '--p2p.protocol=66' also works for me... running 2.39.0 at the moment

https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/issues/6856#issuecomment-1434302406

Same story with Erigon 2.39.0 Polygon:
```

[INFO] [02-23|11:45:13.540] Req/resp stats                           req=707 reqMin=39600961 reqMax=39619589 skel=15 skelMin=39601151 skelMax=39638207 resp=1314 respMin=39600962 respMax=39619590 dups=114156
```

after a few days success with `--p2p.protocol=66`, `erigon 2.39.0` the issue come back to bite me again. this is a blocker to run erigon for BSC & Polygon. any possibility that erigon team (@AskAlexSharov) can prioritise this? thank you

Have anybody found a solution/workaround for this on Polygon????

I'm running polygon-mainnet-archival

Rn I have to run v2.33.2 version - cos it has less frequent `No block headers to write`

I tryed `--p2p.protocol=66` on up to 2.39 versions - no luck I couldn't get even synced node

This is really a blocker, and I see that not only for me

Sorry for pinging @AskAlexSharov but this is a pretty old issue, what the plan around it??

> @vlad-she try Erigon 2.40.1.

Thank you for letting now, trying now.
Will update if any issues
This issue is stale because it has been open for 40 days with no activity. Remove stale label or comment, or this will be closed in 7 days.
This issue was closed because it has been stalled for 7 days with no activity.
